intro: Disemma carinata, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers, which bloom in the summer months. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and is often found growing in rocky or mountainous terrain. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Disemma carinata is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
